newsitem.title: PORTUGAL: BPI approves 21.5 mln share capital increase.
newsitem.headline: BPI approves 21.5 mln share capital increase.

text.p: An extraordinary meeting of Portuguese bank Banco Portugues de Investimento (BPI) approved a capital increase of 21.5 million shares at 1,400 escudos per share, a statement said.

"The 30.1 billion escudo ($196 million) capital increase is part of the financing operation for the acquisition of Banco de Fomento e Exterior, which will permit the BPI group to preserve its financial solidity," BPI said.
In August BPI bought a 65 percent stake of state-owned BFE for $900 million to create Portugal's fourth biggest banking group.
Analysts said the capital call was underwritten and expressed optimism that most shareholders would subscribe.
BPI is expected to announce a further 30 billion escudo capital call for non-vote preferential shares in the first quarter of 1997 to complete the purchase of BFE, they said.
On Tuesday BPI announced a 71 percent year-on-year increase in its net profit for the first nine months of 1996 to 12.1 billion escudos.

The bank said the consolidated figures for the first nine months included costs arising from the purchase of BFE. But BFE would only be consolidated into the accounts in the final quarter of the year.
BPI said it estimated that the "goodwill" in the acquisition of BFE was 39 billion escudos.
BPI shares stood at 1,816 escudos, up 11, in volume of 70,284 shares at 1441 GMT.
